did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: Filmmaker. The collection includes primarily film, videotapes, and audiotapes pertaining to the making of Lori Hiris' film, With a Vengeance: The Fight for Reproductive Freedom. [NOTE: The contents list for this collection is not online. Contact the Sophia Smith Collection if you would like one sent to you.]

bioghist.p: Lori Hiris was born in Albany, New York, the daughter of Irene and Arno Hiris. She graduated from Shenendehowa High School in Clifton Park, New York, and from Saratoga Warren BOCES (Board Of Cooperative Educational Services), in 1982. She earned her B.S. degree at the Syracuse University Newhouse School of Communications in 1986; her M.A. degree in political science from the New School for Social Research in 1994; and completed her MFA degree at Montana State University in 2009. Hiris has made numerous films, including With a Vengeance: The Fight for Reproductive Freedom, and has won many honors and awards for her work.

accessrestrict.p:
The papers are open to research according to the regulations of the Sophia Smith Collection with the following caveats:
This collection has not been fully processed and therefore may be difficult to use.
Portions of collection are stored offsite; researchers must give 48 hours advance notice.
Access to audiovisual or digital materials may first require production of research copies.

userestrict.p: Lori Hiris retains copyright to her film With a Vengeance: The Fight for Reproductive Freedom. The SSC owns copyright to other unpublished works of Lori Hiris in the collection. Copyright to materials authored by others may be owned by those individuals or their heirs or assigns. Permission must be obtained to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use." It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify and satisfy the holders of all copyrights.

Lori Hiris Papers, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.
